Guava Glycemic Index

The glycemic index of guava is relatively low. It averages around 40-50 on the glycemic index, depending on the variety and ripeness of the fruit. Guavas are a great option for those who manage their blood sugar and are looking for a low glycemic alternative to other fruits. Guavas contain essential vitamins and dietary fibers, making them a nutritious and healthy option. They are also extremely versatile and can be eaten raw, cooked, or juiced. Guavas are a great addition to any diet and offer a variety of health benefits.

Guava has a much lower glycemic index value compared to other fruits, making it an ideal choice for individuals with diabetes. The average glycemic index of guava is just 55, while other fruits like banana, grapes, and mangoes have a glycemic index of over 60. Guava is also a good source of dietary fiber which helps to reduce the rise in blood sugar levels. In addition, guava is packed with antioxidants and have high levels of vitamin C, making it a great choice to maintain healthy blood sugar levels. Therefore, for individuals with diabetes, guava is an excellent choice as it can help regulate blood sugar levels without compromising on the taste.

Here are the top 5 food prepared with guava for diabetics: Guava Salad, Guava Chutney, Guava Smoothie, Baked Guava, and Guava Parfait. Guava Salad is a light and healthy option that is packed with essential vitamins and minerals. Guava Chutney is a flavorful condiment that can be used to top foods and add a delicious dimension of flavor. Guava Smoothie is a creamy and refreshing drink that can be enjoyed for breakfast or a midday snack. Baked Guava is a great dessert option for diabetics as it is low in sugar and high in fiber. Lastly, Guava Parfait is a delicious and healthy option that can be enjoyed for breakfast or as a snack. These recipes are great for diabetics who are looking for tasty and nutritious guava-based meals.
